You are a GUI agent. You are given a task and your action history, with screenshots. You need to perform the next action to complete the task.

## Output Format
```
Thought: ...
Action: ...
```

## Action Space

click(start_box='<|box_start|>(x1,y1)<|box_end|>')
left_double(start_box='<|box_start|>(x1,y1)<|box_end|>')
right_single(start_box='<|box_start|>(x1,y1)<|box_end|>')
drag(start_box='<|box_start|>(x1,y1)<|box_end|>', end_box='<|box_start|>(x3,y3)<|box_end|>')
hotkey(key='')
type(content='') #If you want to submit your input, use "\n" at the end of `content`.
scroll(start_box='<|box_start|>(x1,y1)<|box_end|>', direction='down or up or right or left')
wait() #Sleep for 5s and take a screenshot to check for any changes.
finished(content='xxx') # Use escape characters \', \", and \n in content part to ensure we can parse the content in normal python string format.

## Note
- Use English in `Thought` part.
- Write a small plan and finally summarize your next action (with its target element) in one sentence in `Thought` part.
- My computer's password is 'password', feel free to use it when you need sudo rights.

## User Instruction
Please help me make the first letter of each word to uppercase.

Thought: I noticed that there’s an entire document on the screen, and to change all the words to have their first letters capitalized, I need to select everything first. The easiest way to do this is by pressing Ctrl+A, which allows me to highlight all the text at once.
Action: hotkey(key='ctrl a')

Thought: Alright, I've selected all the text. Now, let me see where I can find the option to capitalize the first letter of each word... Ah, there's a "Format" menu at the top; clicking on it should lead me to what I'm looking for.
Action: click(start_box='<|box_start|>(289,74)<|box_end|>')

Thought: The Format menu has been expanded, and I can see the Text option inside it. This should be the entry point for adjusting text formatting. Let me click on it to proceed with setting up the capitalization of the first letter.
Action: click(start_box='<|box_start|>(299,102)<|box_end|>')

Thought: I found the option I needed under the Text submenu - "Capitalize Every Word." This feature perfectly matches our requirement to capitalize the first letter of every word. By clicking on it, I can easily convert all the text into title case format.
Action: click(start_box='<|box_start|>(627,513)<|box_end|>')

Thought: That's great! The text has been successfully converted to title case. To make sure these changes aren't lost, I need to quickly hit Ctrl+S to save the document. After all, nobody wants their hard work on formatting adjustments to go to waste.
Action: hotkey(key='ctrl s')

Thought: I just finished a series of actions: selecting all the text, locating the Format menu, finding the Text option, and then clicking on Capitalize Every Word. Now, every word in the document starts with a capital letter. Finally, I saved these changes using Ctrl+S. It seems that this task has been successfully completed.
Action: finished(content='我已经把每个单词的首字母大写了，并且保存了文档。')
